title: Free warnings, better catalogs: the real fix for space safety
summary: The article discusses the debate around whether the U.S. should charge satellite operators for space situational awareness (SSA) and space traffic coordination (STC) services. It argues that the focus should be on improving hazard detection and characterization rather than imposing fees, citing Europe's free SSA services as a model. The author emphasizes the need for stable funding and outcome-based standards for civil space safety.
why_it_matters: The discussion highlights the potential impact of fee-based SSA/STC services on U.S. influence in space safety norms and the adoption of its civil services. It underscores the importance of measurable improvements in hazard detection and coordination to ensure safety in a multi-system global environment.
